00019 
00020 #include "util/chksum.h"
00021 
00022 using namespace affxutil;
00023 
00024 /*
00025  * Store the one's complement of the checksum in the header of the data.
00026  * To validate the data, compute the one's complement of the data. The
00027  * resulting checksum should be zero.
00028  */
00029 uint16_t CheckSum::OnesComplementCheckSum(void *addr, size_t size)
00030 {
00031         uint16_t *pdata = (uint16_t *)addr;
00032         uint32_t sum = 0;
00033         uint16_t checksum;
00034 
00035         // Compute Internet Checksum for "size" bytes
00036         // beginning at location "addr".
00037         while( size > 1 )
00038         {
00039                 sum += *pdata++;
00040                 size -= 2;
00041         }
00042 
00043         // Add left-over byte, if any
00044         if( size > 0 )
00045                 sum += * (unsigned char *) pdata;
00046 
00047         // Fold 32-bit sum to 16 bits
00048         while (sum>>16)
00049                 sum = (sum & 0xffff) + (sum >> 16);
00050 
00051         // Compute the one's complement of the checksum.
00052         checksum = (uint16_t) ~sum;
00053         return checksum;
00054 }
